qas.question: What empire included all of the Balkan Peninsula north to the southern edge of the Hungarian Plain at the beginning of the 19th century?
When did the Ottoman Empire lose all of it's empire except Constantinople and Eastern Thrace?
The rise of what saw the independence of Greece, Serbia, the Danubian Principalities and Bulgaria?
Until what year did the Ottomans retain a band of territory including Albania, Macedonia and Thrace?
When did the Ottomans lose the territory of Albania, Macedonia and Thrace?

context: At the beginning of the 19th century <a0_0>the Ottoman Empire<a0_0/> included all of the Balkan Peninsula north to the southern edge of the Hungarian Plain, but by <a1_0>1914<a1_0/> had lost all of it except Constantinople and Eastern Thrace to <a2_0>the rise of Balkan nationalism<a2_0/>, which saw the independence of Greece, Serbia, the Danubian Principalities and Bulgaria. Up until <a3_0>1912<a3_0/> the Ottomans retained a band of territory including Albania, Macedonia and Thrace, which were lost in <a4_0>the two Balkan Wars of 1912–13<a4_0/>.
